page.title: 11Farming Part 3
page.content: As soon as the first of the crops has been harvested tractors with large four-furrow ploughs, many of them reversible, that is having two sets of ploughs one upside down to the other enabling the driver to work backwards and forwards instead of going round and round a large area, plough the fields. After the ground has been ploughed and harrowed, or raked, The seed driller will come along and sow the winter barley or wheat, or oil seed rape. In about ten days time the green shoots will appear and the farmer will say that the crop has {breared.}Throughout the winter fields, which at one time would have been brown stubbles, are green and fresh. In spring the other crops such as spring barley, oats, peas, beans, potatoes and turnips are sown or planted.
